alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 20 at 4:14PM AKST until January 21 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 9 PM AKST FRIDAY FROM KENAI TO ANCHOR POINT... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...From 9 AM to 9 PM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Initially strong easterly winds early on Friday will limit precipitation. Any precipitation that does develop should fall as snow. However, winds will transition to a southerly direction over the latter half of the day. This will result in increasing precipitation as well as warming temperatures to above freezing. The end result will be snow changing over to freezing rain Friday afternoon into Friday evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
